page.title: 16Spottes Glen
page.content: George Smith has been employed by Sir Michael Herries of Spottes Hall for the past 15 years as estate handyman. This includes game keeping. George was born on the estate of Spottes 59 years ago. Sir Michael's estate is about 1,200 acres. George rears about 200 pheasants on the estate. They now buy them in at about 6 weeks old. The main vermin is foxes and carrion crows. They feed the pheasants on barley and wheat. The mill at Glen of Spottes ceased to work about 45 years ago. There used to be a house there. The joiner's shop was above the mill (with the remains still there). Nowadays people often walk their dogs, go for a swim below the waterfall or fish there. There is a footbridge halfway down the glen. On the map there is reference to a chapel but only a few stones are left.
